Documentation and Dictionaries

Source: vignettes/documentation_and_dictionaries.Rmd
documentation_and_dictionaries.Rmd

Understanding Datasets Names

ColOpenData has three modules: demographic, geospatial and climate. All the available datasets have different details and aggregation and a naming system that is used to retrieve the data. All datasets need to have a source, given name, year and additional details for identification. They can be consulted using a common framework:

SOURCE_NAME_YEAR_DETAILS

Currently, ColOpenData only includes data from official sources (DANE) and (IDEAM). Name, year and details are different for each module, and provide an unique name for each dataset.

Demographic

Demographic datasets are available for municipalities and departments, and contain data for Houses and Population in four categories.

  • Viviendas (Houses)
  • Hogares (Homes)
  • Personas Social (Social)
  • Personas Demográfico (Demographic)

All datasets are retrieved from DANE, and are correspond to observed data from the National Population and Dwelling Census (CNPV). Naming is stated as follows:

  • Source: DANE
  • Name: Names include the categories
    • Viviendas: CNPVV
    • Hogares: CNPVH
    • Personas Social: CNPVPS
    • Personas Demográfico: CNPVPD
  • Year: 2018
  • Details: These are related to each individual dataset, and can be related to their identifier and spatial level of aggregation. For further details please check the function list_datasets below.

Geospatial

Geospatial datasets naming is related to the level of aggregation, since they are available from Blocks to Departments. All these datasets come from DANE, and are part of the Geostatistical National Framework (MGN), which for 2018 includes a summarized version of the National Population and Dwelling Census (CNPV). Naming is stated as follows:

  • Source: DANE
  • Name: The name is related to both the MGN and the CNPV: MGNCNPV
  • Year: 2018
  • Details: These are related to the level of aggregation:
    • Department: DPTO
    • Municipality: MPIO
    • Municipality including Class MPIOCL
    • Block: MZN
    • Rural Sector: SETR
    • Urban Sector: SETU
    • Rural Section: SECR
    • Urban Section: SECU
    • Urban Zone: ZU

Climate

This module has only one dataset, and the information required to use the related functions is related to the area of interest, dates, frequency of measurement and tags consulted. Therefore, this module does not use the same framework for naming, and the dataset name is only useful to retrieve the dictionary for the individual tags.

List data

To check available datasets you can use the list_datasets function. This function can also be filtered with the module parameter to indicate a specific module

library(ColOpenData)
# List all datasets
datasets <- list_datasets()
print(datasets)
#> # A tibble: 104 × 7
#>    name                     group      source  year level   category description
#>    <chr>                    <chr>      <chr>  <dbl> <chr>   <chr>    <chr>      
#>  1 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_DPTO   geospatial DANE    2018 Depart… maps     Geographic…
#>  2 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MPIO   geospatial DANE    2018 Munici… maps     Geographic…
#>  3 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MPIOCL geospatial DANE    2018 Munici… maps     Geographic…
#>  4 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SETU   geospatial DANE    2018 Urban … maps     Geographic…
#>  5 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SETR   geospatial DANE    2018 Rural … maps     Geographic…
#>  6 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECU   geospatial DANE    2018 Urban … maps     Geographic…
#>  7 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECR   geospatial DANE    2018 Rural … maps     Geographic…
#>  8 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MZN    geospatial DANE    2018 Block   maps     Geographic…
#>  9 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_ZU     geospatial DANE    2023 Urban … maps     Geographic…
#> 10 IDEAM_CLIMATE_2023_MAY   climate    IDEAM   2023 Munici… weather  Available …
#> # ℹ 94 more rows
# List geospatial datasets
geo_datasets <- list_datasets(module = "geospatial")
print(geo_datasets)
#> # A tibble: 9 × 7
#>   name                     group      source  year level    category description
#>   <chr>                    <chr>      <chr>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr>    <chr>      
#> 1 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_DPTO   geospatial DANE    2018 Departm… maps     Geographic…
#> 2 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MPIO   geospatial DANE    2018 Municip… maps     Geographic…
#> 3 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MPIOCL geospatial DANE    2018 Municip… maps     Geographic…
#> 4 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SETU   geospatial DANE    2018 Urban S… maps     Geographic…
#> 5 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SETR   geospatial DANE    2018 Rural S… maps     Geographic…
#> 6 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECU   geospatial DANE    2018 Urban S… maps     Geographic…
#> 7 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECR   geospatial DANE    2018 Rural S… maps     Geographic…
#> 8 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MZN    geospatial DANE    2018 Block    maps     Geographic…
#> 9 DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_ZU     geospatial DANE    2023 Urban Z… maps     Geographic…

Dictionaries

Demographic

Dictionaries are not provided for this module.

Geospatial

Datasets inside the geospatial module contain a summarized version of the National Population and Dwelling Census (CNPV) and a dictionary is needed to understand all aggregated variables. These dictionaries contain the necessary metadata to use the available information. To retrieve them, we can use the dictionaryfunction, using the dataset name as a parameter:

dictionary("DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_MPIO")
#> # A tibble: 88 × 5
#>    variable   tipo         longitud descripcion               categoria_original
#>    <chr>      <chr>           <dbl> <chr>                     <chr>             
#>  1 DPTO_CCDGO Text                2 Código del departamento   NA                
#>  2 MPIO_CCDGO Text                3 Código que identifica al… NA                
#>  3 MPIO_CNMBR Text              250 Nombre del municipio      NA                
#>  4 MPIO_CDPMP Text                5 Código concatenado que i… NA                
#>  5 VERSION    Long Integer       NA Año de la información ge… NA                
#>  6 AREA       Double             NA Área del municipio en me… NA                
#>  7 LATITUD    Double             NA Coordenada de latitud ce… NA                
#>  8 LONGITUD   Double             NA Coordenada de longitud c… NA                
#>  9 STCTNENCUE Double             NA Cantidad de Encuestas CN… NA                
#> 10 STP3_1_SI  Double             NA Cantidad de encuestas qu… NA                
#> # ℹ 78 more rows

Climate

Climate data is not stored in multiple datasets but as an unique dataset with numerous tags. These tags can also be consulted through the dictionary function using the name of the climate dataset.

dict_climate <- dictionary("IDEAM_CLIMATE_2023_MAY")
print(dict_climate)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 3
#>    etiqueta   variable                                   frecuencia             
#>    <chr>      <chr>                                      <chr>                  
#>  1 TSSM_CON   Temperatura seca (ambiente)                Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#>  2 THSM_CON   Temperatura húmeda                         Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#>  3 TMN_CON    Temperatura mínima                         Diaria                 
#>  4 TMX_CON    Temperatura máxima                         Diaria                 
#>  5 TSTG_CON   Temperatura seca (ambiente) del termógrafo Horaria (24 horas)     
#>  6 HR_CAL     Humedad relativa                           Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#>  7 HRHG_CON   Humedad relativa del hidrógrafo            Horaria (24 horas      
#>  8 TV_CAL     Tensión de vapor                           Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#>  9 TPR_CAL    Punto de rocío                             Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#> 10 PTPM_CON   Precipitación                              Diaria                 
#> 11 PTPG_CON   Precipitación                              Horaria (24 horas)     
#> 12 EVTE_CON   Evaporación                                Diaria                 
#> 13 FA_CON     Fenómeno atmosférico                       Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#> 14 NB_CON     Nubosidad                                  Horaria (07:00, 13:00,…
#> 15 RCAM_CON   Recorrido del viento                       Diaria                 
#> 16 BSHG_CON   Brillo solar                               Horaria (14 horas)     
#> 17 VVAG_CON   Velocidad del viento                       Horaria (24 horas)     
#> 18 DVAG_CON   Dirección del viento                       Horaria (24 horas)     
#> 19 VVMXAG_CON Velocidad máxima del viento                Diaria                 
#> 20 DVMXAG_CON Dirección máxima del viento                Diaria

Climate dictionary includes the available tags to use in the functions download_cliamte, download_climate_geom and download_climate_stations. These tags allow the user to download specific climate attributes for their desired area of interest.
